WYSIWYM.ontology
Class OntologyWriter

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.ontology.OntologyWriter

public class OntologyWriter
extends Object

OntologyWriter creates RDF and SPARQL. For the editing module, it takes a SemanticGraph and creates a RDF-representation. For the querying module it generates SPARQL queries that represent the QueryGraph. It also contains a number of static methods that return particular queries with information that LIBER frequently needs. Most of these methods are domain-specific, using the PolicyGrid ontologies!

Version:
1.1 27-02-2007, 1.2 March 2008, 1.3 22-05-2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

getUserIDQuery

public static String getUserIDQuery(String name)
Get ID's and registration yes/no of users by this name. This information is used by the ourSpaces registration widget to find all non-registered users with a certain name.

Parameters:
name - Username
Returns:
String SPARQL

getUserQuery

public static String getUserQuery(String user)
Creates a query that asks for the full name, email, employer and deposited resources of all persons that have the given name, e.g.: Select ?name ?email ?org ?resource ?title Where { ?x a Person. ?x Name ?name. filter (regex(?name, user, "i")) OPTIONAL {{?x Email ?email.} UNION {?x Email ?y. ?y ?z ?email}} //check for sequences OPTIONAL {{?x EmployeeOf ?organisation.} UNION {?organisation HasEmployee ?x.} ?organisation Name ?name.} OPTIONAL {{?x DepositorOf ?resource.} UNION {?resource DepositedBy ?x.} ?resource Title ?title.}}

Parameters:
user - Username
Returns:
String SPARQL

getUserDescriptionQuery

public static String getUserDescriptionQuery(String first,
                                             String last)
Returns a SPARQL query that takes a user's first and last name and retrieves his full name, email, organisation, project, documents he's written, when those were uploaded, and whether he's registered. This information is used by the ourSpaces registration widget to find and present all non-registered users with a certain name.

Parameters:
first - First name
last - Last, family name
Returns:
String SPARQL

getInstanceNrQuery

public static String getInstanceNrQuery(String type,
                                        OntologyReader r)
Returns a query that finds all instances of a certain class. select ?x where {?x a namespace:type.}

Parameters:
type - Class type
r - Ontology
Returns:
String SPARQL

getConnectedObjectsOfTypeQuery

public String getConnectedObjectsOfTypeQuery(String[] range,
                                             String userID,
                                             String projectID)
Returns a query that finds all instances of the classes in range, which are only one step removed from user or project. select ?x ?name ?title ?username where { {?x a ConferencePaper.} UNION {?x a JournalPaper.} {?x ?p .} UNION {?x ?p .} {?x utility:name ?name} UNION {?x resource:Title ?title.}}

Parameters:
range - Class types
userID - Sesame user ID
projectID - Sesame project ID
Returns:
String SPARQL

getPropertyValuesQuery

public String getPropertyValuesQuery(String id,
                                     List<String> properties)
Returns a query that finds the values that the object with the given id has for the given properties. select ?v1 ?v2 where {OPTIONAL{ property1 ?v1.} OPTIONAL{ property2 ?v2.}}

Parameters:
id - Sesame ID
properties - Property names
Returns:
String SPARQL

getObjectQuery

public String getObjectQuery(String title,
                             String[] types)
Returns a query that finds all objects with the given type and title, and includes information about people connected to it to help the user identify it.

Parameters:
title - Title
types - Class types
Returns:
String SPARQL

getObjectQuery

public String getObjectQuery(InstanceData data)
Returns all objects that match the given description, and also some extra information about how they are connected to people, to help the user identify them.

Parameters:
data - Form data
Returns:
String SPARQL

getNameSpace

public static String getNameSpace(OntResource r)
Returns the namespace of the given resource. Used to determine prefixes.

Parameters:
r - OntResource
Returns:
String namespace

getNLQuery

public static String getNLQuery(String id)
Returns a query that finds all information important for NL presentation of the given object (i.e. its type and, if specified, its name or title. E.g.prefix project: prefix resource: prefix rdf: select ?name ?title ?type ?uri ?access where { rdf:type ?type. OPTIONAL{ project:Name ?name.} OPTIONAL{ resource:Title ?title.} OPTIONAL{ resource:HasURI ?uri.} OPTIONAL{ resource:AccessConditions ?access.}}

Parameters:
id - Sesame ID
Returns:
String SPARQL

getTypeQuery

public static String getTypeQuery(String id)
Returns a query that finds the type of the given id.

Parameters:
id - Sesame ID
Returns:
String SPARQL

getDescriptionQuery

public static String getDescriptionQuery(String id)
Creates a query that finds all statements that have the given id as their subject. CONSTRUCT { ?y ?z. } WHERE { ?y ?z. }

Parameters:
id - Sesame ID
Returns:
String SPARQL

getPrefix

public static String getPrefix(int ontology)
Returns a SPARQL sentence that defines a prefix. The argument, an integer between 0 and 4, determines for which ontology the prefix is defined. 0 is RDF, 1 is Utility, 2 is Resource, 3 is Task, 4 is Geography.

Parameters:
ontology - Ontology
Returns:
String SPARQL prefix

getSPARQL

public String getSPARQL(SemanticGraph sg)
                 throws SPARQLException
Transforms the semantic graph into SPARQL. This method is used by LIBER's Querying module.

Parameters:
sg - SemanticGraph
Returns:
String SPARQL
Throws:
SPARQLException

getRDF

public String getRDF(SemanticGraph sg,
                     SesameReader sesame)
Transforms the semantic graph into RDF (RDFXML), which is stored in the Sesame repository accessed by the given SesameReader. The RDF is also returned.

Parameters:
sg - SemanticGraph
sesame - SesameReader
Returns:
String RDF
